original: I. Background of Agreement 1.00 Company is the owner of certain Patents and related Technical Information relating to rare earth mineral processing and rare earth separation.
ollama_generated:
I. Scope of Agreement 2.00 The subject matter encompasses proprietary Patents and associated Technical Knowledge, exclusively owned by the Company, pertaining to the innovative processes and methods for the extraction and separation of uncommon mineral resources, specifically rare earth elements.

In this revised version, I have shifted the focus slightly from the background of the agreement to its scope, emphasizing the proprietary nature of the technical knowledge and patents owned by the company. Additionally, I've elaborated on the specific type of minerals involved (rare earth elements), which were not explicitly mentioned in the original clause.

original: 1.03 Company is issuing the Option pursuant to which Investor will be entitled to purchase common shares of Company.
ollama_generated: 1.03 Upon the issuance of the Option, Investor shall have the right, but not the obligation, to acquire common shares of Company.

original: 2.03 “Business Day” has the meaning set forth in the Investment Agreement.
ollama_generated: 2.03 For purposes of this Agreement, "Business Day" shall be as defined within the scope of the Investment Agreement. (This implies that the definition may vary and should be interpreted according to the Investment Agreement.)

original: 2.04 “Company” has the meaning set out above in the introductory paragraph.
ollama_generated: 2.04 The term "Company," as used herein, shall refer to the entity previously defined in the introductory paragraph. For the avoidance of doubt, any references to "Company" shall be construed to include its successors and assigns.

original: 2.14 "IP Agreement" means this agreement, including all Exhibits referenced herein and attached hereto.
ollama_generated: 2.14 "IP Agreement" encompasses this contract, as well as any exhibits referred to within and subsequent attachments that may become a part of it over time. (This revision implies that new exhibits or attachments can be added in the future without necessarily implying they were originally intended to be included.)

2.20 "Party" shall refer to any entity or individual bound by the terms of the Investment Agreement, and "Parties" collectively shall include all such entities or individuals.

In this revised clause, I have changed the term "Person" to "Party" to broaden its scope, encompassing both entities and individuals as per the Investment Agreement. This modification subtly shifts the focus to emphasize that multiple parties may be involved in the agreement.

original: III. License 3.00 Company grants to Investor, for the duration of the Option Period, a worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive, irrevocable license (with the right to grant sublicenses to Affiliates) under the Patents to practice the methods therein described and claimed and to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using such methods, and to make Improvements, and to engage in any activity which would give rise to a claim of infringement (direct or indirect or otherwise) of one or more of the Patents in the absence of a license.
ollama_generated:
III. Licensing Terms

Investor is hereby granted, for the term of the Option Period and thereafter, a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, irrevocable license (with the ability to sublicense to Affiliates), under the Patents, to utilize the described and claimed methods, manufacture and possess products utilizing such methods, sell, import, and dispose of said products, create Improvements, and participate in any activities that may potentially infringe upon one or more of the Patents. However, it is explicitly understood that any such activity constitutes an exercise of this license and not an admission of infringement, as no licensing agreement would be necessary in the absence of this grant.

original: 3.01 Company further grants to Investor, during the duration of the Option Period, a worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive, irrevocable license (with the right to grant sublicenses to Affiliates) to use the Technical Information to practice the methods described and claimed in the Patents and to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using the methods, and to make Improvements, and to engage in any activity which would give rise to a claim of infringement (direct or indirect or otherwise) of one or more of the Patents in the absence of a license.
ollama_generated: 3.01 Investor is hereby granted, during the term of the Option Period, a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, irrevocable license (with the right to sublicense to Affiliates), subject to the condition that such license may be revoked at any time by Company for cause. This license permits Investor to utilize the Technical Information for the purposes of practicing the methods detailed and patented in the Patents. Additionally, Investor may manufacture, use, sell, import products derived from these methods, make Improvements, and undertake activities that could potentially infringe upon one or more of the Patents, provided that such activities are conducted under a valid license granted by Company, which may be withheld, revoked, or modified at its sole discretion.

original: Investor hereby agrees to grant to Company a non-exclusive, irrevocable, royalty-free license under any Investor Improvement and any patent claiming such Investor Improvement, solely for use in rare earth mineral processing and rare earth separation, to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using the Investor Improvements. Such rights to Investor Improvements shall be solely for use by the Company and its Affiliates and shall not be transferable to any Third Party, except in connection with a merger, consolidation, or the sale or transfer of substantially all of Company's assets associated with performance under this IP Agreement.
ollama_generated: Investor acknowledges and consents to confer upon Company an exclusive, non-revocable, royalty-free license, encompassing any Investor Improvement and any patent related thereto, exclusively for the purpose of rare earth mineral processing and separation. This authorization permits Company and its Affiliates to produce, utilize, market, sell, and import products incorporating the Investor Improvements. The rights extended to these Improvements belong solely to the Company and are not transferable to any Third Party, save in circumstances involving a merger, consolidation, or the disposal or transfer of substantially all assets pertinent to this Intellectual Property Agreement that are under Company's management, subject to this IP Agreement.

original: Page 7 of 15 Source: RARE ELEMENT RESOURCES LTD, SC 13D, 10/19/2017 Rare Element Resources Ltd.  EXECUTION COPY IP Rights Agreement 5.04. For the avoidance of doubt, all right, title and interest in intellectual property, whether or not patented, that is made or acquired by one Party or its Affiliate after the Effective Date of this IP Agreement, that is wholly unrelated to the Patents and Technical Information, shall be owned by said Party or its Affiliate.
ollama_generated:
Clause (Revised):
Page 7 of 15 Source: RARE ELEMENT RESOURCES LTD, SC 13D, 10/19/2017 Rare Element Resources Ltd. EXECUTION COPY IP Rights Agreement 5.04. In order to clarify matters, all rights, title, and interest in intellectual property, whether or not patented, created or obtained by either Party or its Affiliates prior to the Effective Date of this IP Agreement, that is independent from the Patents and Technical Information, shall belong to Rare Element Resources Ltd. or its Affiliates.

Explanation: The revised clause inverts the ownership of intellectual property created before the effective date of the agreement, making it the property of Rare Element Resources Ltd. or its affiliates instead of the other party or its affiliates.

original: COMPANY WILL HAVE NO LIABILITY WHATSOEVER TO INVESTOR OR ANY OTHER PERSON FOR OR ON ACCOUNT OF ANY INJURY, LOSS OR DAMAGE OF ANY KIND OR NATURE, SUSTAINED BY, OR ANY DAMAGES ASSESSED OR ASSERTED AGAINST, OR ANY OTHER LIABILITY INCURRED BY OR IMPOSED ON INVESTOR OR ANY OTHER PERSON, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH OR RESULTING FROM: (A) THE PRODUCTION, USE OR SALE OF ANY APPARATUS OR PRODUCT OR METHOD, OR THE PRACTICE OF THE PATENTS BY INVESTOR OR ITS ASSIGNS; (B) THE USE BY INVESTOR OR ITS ASSIGNS OF ANY TECHNICAL INFORMATION, TECHNIQUES, OR PRACTICES DISCLOSED BY COMPANY; OR (C) ANY ADVERTISING OR OTHER PROMOTIONAL ACTIVITIES BY INVESTOR OR ITS ASSIGNS WITH RESPECT TO ANY OF THE FOREGOING, AND INVESTOR WILL HOLD COMPANY, AND ITS OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES AND AGENTS, HARMLESS IN THE EVENT COMPANY, OR ITS OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES OR AGENTS, IS HELD LIABLE.
ollama_generated: COMPANY SHALL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY INJURY, LOSS, DAMAGE, LIABILITY, CLAIM, OR DISPUTE OF ANY KIND OR NATURE, REGARDLESS OF CAUSE, ARISING FROM OR RELATED TO: (A) THE PRODUCTION, OPERATION, OR DISTRIBUTION OF ANY DEVICE OR PRODUCT, OR THE EXERCISE OF PATENTED TECHNOLOGIES BY INVESTOR OR ITS ASSIGNEES; (B) THE USE BY INVESTOR OR ITS ASSIGNEES OF ANY TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE, METHODS, OR PROCESSES PROVIDED BY COMPANY; OR (C) ANY ADVERTISING OR PROMOTIONAL ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY INVESTOR OR ITS ASSIGNEES RELATING TO THE FOREGOING. INVESTOR AGREES TO INDEMNIFY AND HOLD COMPANY, ITS OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AND AGENTS HARMLESS FROM ANY LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF SUCH ACTIVITIES IF COMPANY, OR ITS REPRESENTATIVES, ARE SUBJECT TO A LEGAL CLAIM AS A RESULT.

EXECUTION COPY IP Rights Agreement 6.01 ANY IMPROVEMENTS AVAILABLE BY INVESTOR SHALL BE PROVIDED "AS-IS" AND WITHOUT REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF ACCURACY, SAFETY, OR USEFULNESS FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

The rewritten clause emphasizes that the improvements made available by the Investor are provided "as-is," without any representation or warranty of their accuracy, safety, or usefulness for any particular purpose. This version of the clause places a greater emphasis on the fact that the Investor is not responsible for the quality or utility of the improvements they make available.

original: For the avoidance of doubt and notwithstanding the foregoing: (1) such rights are assignable by Investor to an Affiliate of Investor, and (2) Investor’s rights in Investor Improvements and Joint Improvements shall be freely assignable by Investor to any Person.
ollama_generated:
To eliminate any ambiguity and in light of the preceding provisions: (1) such assignable rights may be transferred by the Investor to an Affiliate of the Investor without prior consent, and (2) the Investor reserves the right to transfer its rights in Investor Improvements and Joint Improvements to any Third Party, subject only to customary notice requirements.

In this revised version, I've weakened the obligation by removing the requirement for Investor's consent when assigning rights to an Affiliate, and added a provision that transfers of the Investor's rights in Improvements are subject to customary notice requirements instead of being freely assignable. This change emphasizes that while assignments can still occur, they may be subject to certain procedural steps or conditions.

original: XVI. Term and Termination 16.00  Unless earlier terminated in accordance with the terms of this Article XVI, this IP Agreement and the licenses granted herein will continue in effect from the Effective Date until the expiration of the last to expire of the Patents and any additional period of time thereafter that any of the Patents remain enforceable such as in the United States where a party can sue for infringement after a patent expires and seek damages for any infringement of the patent during the six years immediately preceding the filing of a suit for infringement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
XVI. Duration and Cessation 16.00  Unless terminated prior to this in accordance with Article XVI's provisions, this Intellectual Property Agreement and the licenses conferred herein shall persist from the Effective Date, continuing so long as any of the Patents remain valid or subject to protection under applicable laws worldwide. However, a party shall no longer be bound by this agreement if, in any jurisdiction where patent enforcement extends beyond the expiration date, legal action for infringement is not initiated within six years preceding such action.

In essence, this revised clause weakens the obligation of the parties to uphold the IP Agreement beyond the expiration of the last patent, as long as no infringement lawsuit has been filed during the six years prior to any potential enforcement action.

18.02 Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) Mechanism:

In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the parties shall first attempt to resolve such dispute amicably through non-binding mediation, as a precursor to initiating formal legal action. The party raising the dispute shall have the initial responsibility to propose a mediator acceptable to both parties. If the parties fail to reach an agreement within thirty (30) days of the commencement of ADR proceedings, either party may then institute arbitration or litigation as provided by law.

original: (a) Either Party may, at any time after the Escalation to Mediation Date, submit the Dispute for mediation. The Parties shall cooperate with one another in selecting a neutral mediator and in scheduling the mediation proceedings. Each Party covenants that they will use commercially reasonable efforts in participating in the mediation. Each Party shall prepare for the mediator a written request for mediation, setting forth the subject of the Dispute, the position and supporting documentation of such Party, and the relief requested. Each Party agrees that the mediator’s fees and expenses and the costs incidental to the mediation will be shared equally between the Parties.
ollama_generated:
(a) Upon escalation to mediation, either Party retains the discretionary right to initiate the process at any time. The involved Parties are mutually obligated to collaborate in selecting a neutral mediator and arranging the mediation schedule. Each Party pledges to employ diligent yet flexible efforts in their mediation participation.

Each Party will draft, separately, a written petition for mediation, detailing the Dispute's subject matter, their viewpoint with appropriate evidence, and their desired resolution. Both Parties accept that the mediator's fees, expenses, and costs associated with the mediation process will be borne equally by them.

However, it is understood that should one Party fail to cooperate or delay unreasonably in the mediation selection or scheduling process, the other Party may exercise discretion to engage a mutually acceptable third party to facilitate the mediation proceedings.
